Set.Text: [ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities can build 1 more [ICON_District] District than the [ICON_Citizen] Population limit allows.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards Medieval, Renaissance, and Industrial [ICON_Science] Era [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonders.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+100% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism from all [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonders.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Floodplains (Tier 2), Rivers (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+15% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_District] Districts and [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonders built next to a [ICON_Terrain] River.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_District] Districts, [ICON_Charges] Improvements, and [ICON_Unit] Units are immune to [ICON_Damaged] Damage from Floods.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities gain effects of Follower Beliefs of all [ICON_Religion] Religions present in the City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for every [ICON_Religion] Religion present in a City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Religion] Missionaries gain +2 Spreads.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+100% [ICON_Religion] Religious pressure in player sent [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Capturing a [ICON_Barbarian] Barbarian Outpost also grants a Tribal Village reward.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5% [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Faith] Faith per City-State Suzerainty.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Levying City-State [ICON_Unit] Units costs 50% less [ICON_Gold] Gold.
[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Hills (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain 1 [ICON_Policy] Wildcard Policy slot in any [ICON_Government] Government.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 3), Woods (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_CITY_CENTER] City Centers gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production adjacency from [ICON_Terrain] Coast or Lake tiles, and +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith adjacency from all [ICON_Terrain] Tundra and Snow tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Units can enter [ICON_Terrain] Ocean tiles at the [ICON_Science] Shipbuilding Technology.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Units pay no [ICON_Movement] Movement cost to embark or disembark.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Naval Melee class Units can heal in neutral territory.
[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_District] Specialty Districts gain bonus adjacency from adjacent [ICON_District] Districts.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Woods/Rainforest (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts, and [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Sculptures gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, as well as +2 [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Production] Production, as well as +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+4 [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work slots in the [ICON_Capital] Palace.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rainforest (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Terrain] Rainforest tiles have a net +1 Appeal.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus, [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] Theater Square, [ICON_DISTRICT_COMMERCIAL_HUB] Commercial Hub, and [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site gain adjacency from [ICON_Terrain] Rainforest.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Tundra (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Founded Cities start with 5 additional tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Faith] Faith on [ICON_Terrain] Tundra tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer point in [ICON_Buildings] Shrine; +1 [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point in [ICON_Buildings] Temple; +1 [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician point in [ICON_Buildings] Tier 3 Buildings of the [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Buildings] Temples gain 2 [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work slots.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_District] Districts, [ICON_Charges] Improvements, and [ICON_Unit] Units are immune to Blizzard [ICON_Damaged] Damage. Enemy [ICON_Unit] Units suffer +100% [ICON_Damaged] Damage from Blizzards in home territory.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Geothermal Fissure (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]May form [ICON_Corps] Fleets and [ICON_Army] Armadas at the [ICON_Culture] Mercantilism Civic.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production, +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +3 [ICON_Gold] Gold; [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain triple the bonus if traveling between [ICON_Terrain] Continents.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+25% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_District] Districts on a [ICON_Terrain] Continent different than the [ICON_Capital] Capital.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+10% [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Culture] Culture from [ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspirations.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain a random [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka and [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration after completing a [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonder.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Terrain] Mountain tiles are workable but have no base yields, [ICON_Charges] Great Wall segments can be placed on [ICON_Terrain] Mountains.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Receive the final [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet automatically.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]When the player uses a [ICON_Religion] Religious Unit to convert a City for the first time, gain 10 [ICON_Science] Science per [ICON_Citizen] Population of that City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Science] Science for every foreign City following the player's [ICON_Religion] Religion.
[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Horses (Tier 2), Grassland/Plains (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Producing a [ICON_Unit] Land Light Cavalry class Unit or Saka Horse Archer creates an additional Unit.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]All player Cities within [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route range create a road to the [ICON_Capital] Capital.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold per player made [ICON_TradingPost] Trade Post that the player's [ICON_TradeRoute] Traders pass through.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]All [ICON_Policy] Diplomatic Policy slots are converted into [ICON_Policy] Wildcard Policy slots in any [ICON_Government] Government.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per [ICON_Policy] Wildcard Policy slot in [ICON_Government] Government.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 3), Iron/Coal (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Extract +2 [ICON_Resource_Iron] Iron and [ICON_Resource_Coal] Coal from [ICON_Charges] Improved Resources.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+100% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_Charges] Military Engineers.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+2 [ICON_Charges] Military Engineer Charges.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Buildings] Buildings that can be [ICON_Power] Powered receive a bonus +4 of their [ICON_Power] Powered yield.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+20% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_DISTRICT_INDUSTRIAL_ZONE] Industrial Zone [ICON_Buildings] Buildings.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_HARBOR] Harbor [ICON_Buildings] Buildings increase [ICON_Resource_Iron] Strategic Resource stockpile by +10.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Builders begin with +1 [ICON_Charges] Charge.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Builder [ICON_Charges] Charges can be expended to complete 20% of a [ICON_District] District's [ICON_Production] Production cost.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Building an [ICON_DISTRICT_ENCAMPMENT] Encampment or [ICON_Charges] Fort triggers a [ICON_Culture] Culture Bomb.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Convert 1 [ICON_Policy] Military Policy slot into 1 [ICON_Policy] Wildcard Policy slot in any [ICON_Government] Government.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 2), Pasture Resources (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+3 [ICON_Housing] Housing in Coastal Cities.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Pastures trigger a [ICON_Culture] Culture Bomb.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus, [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] Theater Square, [ICON_DISTRICT_COMMERCIAL_HUB] Commercial Hub, and [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site gain +1 yields while on tiles with Charming appeal; bonus increases to +3 on tiles with Breathtaking appeal.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Desert (Tier 2), Mine Resources (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+30% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_Unit] Ranged class Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Land Ranged class Units gain [ICON_Ability] +50% Experience.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges] Mines over Strategic Resources gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production; [ICON_Charges] Mines over Bonus and Luxury Resources gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Conquering a Civilization's or City-State's City, that is not a Free City, grants a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for each [ICON_DISTRICT_ENCAMPMENT] Encampment and [ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus present, and a [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration for each [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site and [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] Theater Square present.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Conquering a Civilization's or City-State's City, that is not a Free City, grants a [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for each [ICON_DISTRICT_ENCAMPMENT] Encampment and [ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus present, and a [ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspiration for each [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site and [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] Theater Square present.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity at the [ICON_Culture] Political Philosophy Civic.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Domestic [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Roads inside player territory are one level more advanced than the player's Era level.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus, [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] Theater Square, [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site, and [ICON_DISTRICT_INDUSTRIAL_ZONE] Industrial Zone gain minor adjacency to [ICON_Terrain] Coast and Lake tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_ENTERTAINMENT] Entertainment Complexes gain +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity when adjacent to a [ICON_Terrain] Coast or Lake tile.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]The [ICON_DISTRICT_AQUEDUCT] Aqueduct grants +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity and [ICON_Faith] Faith per [ICON_Citizen] Citizen in a City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+2 [ICON_Food] Food on [ICON_Charges] Farms adjacent to a [ICON_DISTRICT_AQUEDUCT] Aqueduct.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Faith] Faith on [ICON_Charges] Farms adjacent to the [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Horses (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes immediately create [ICON_TradingPost] Trading Posts in destination City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_VisTopSecret] Diplomatic Vision bonus doubled to +6 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength for all [ICON_Unit] Military Units per level of [ICON_VisTopSecret] Intel.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Mountains (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities with an established [ICON_Governor] Governor provide +5% [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Production] Production, and +10% [ICON_Ability] Experience towards all [ICON_Unit] Military Units produced in the City; bonus tripled if the City was [ICON_Occupied] Conquered.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][iCON_Governor] Governors exert +4 [ICON_PressureUp] Loyalty towards all Cities in 9 tiles.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain 1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trader at the [ICON_Science] Pottery Technology.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Unclaimed tiles with 3 tiles of the player's City are annexed when a [ICON_TradeRoute] Trader first moves into them.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Amenities] Happy Cities gain +5% [ICON_Science] Science and [ICON_Production] Production, and generate +1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point in [ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus, and +1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point in [ICON_DISTRICT_INDUSTRIAL_ZONE] Industrial Zone; [ICON_Amenities] Ecstatic Cities double these bonuses.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Hills (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+3 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor per turn.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Gold] Gold, and [ICON_Faith] Faith per [ICON_Envoy] Envoy token sent to an existing City-States.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Units that [ICON_Occupied] Capture a City upgrade into a [ICON_Corps] Corps or [ICON_Army] Army, if the necessary [ICON_Culture] Civics are unlocked.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+3 [ICON_PressureUp] Loyalty per turn in Cities with a garrisoned [ICON_Unit] Unit; increases to +5 [ICON_PressureUp] Loyalty per turn in Cities with a garrisoned [ICON_Corps] Corps or [ICON_Army] Army [ICON_Unit] Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Science] Science and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold in [ICON_DISTRICT_ENCAMPMENT] Ikanda [ICON_Buildings] Buildings.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Dedications chosen at the beginning of a [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age or [ICON_GLORY_SUPER_GOLDEN_AGE] Heroic Age also grant [ICON_GLORY_NORMAL_AGE] Normal Age bonuses towards Era Score.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards all levels of [ICON_Buildings] Walls.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 2), Coast (Tier 4).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Campus, [ICON_DISTRICT_THEATER] Theater Square, [ICON_DISTRICT_HOLYSITE] Holy Site, and [ICON_DISTRICT_INDUSTRIAL_ZONE] Industrial Zone gain major adjacency to [ICON_Terrain] Rivers.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_HARBOR] Harbors trigger a [ICON_Culture] Culture Bomb.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards the [ICON_DISTRICT_DAM] Dam District and [ICON_Buildings] Flood Barrier Building.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Spawns with the [ICON_TechBoosted] Eureka for [ICON_Science] Writing.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +1 [ICON_Science] Science.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Coastal Cities founded by the player and on the same [ICON_Terrain] Continent as the [ICON_Capital] Capital maintain +100 [ICON_PressureUp] Loyalty.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit]Settlers receive +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement and [ICON_VisTopSecret] Sight Radius while embarked, and pay no [ICON_Movement] Movement cost to embark or disembark.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Gain +50 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor upon recruiting a [ICON_GreatPerson] Great Person.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_GreatEngineer] Great Engineer point in [ICON_Buildings] Factory.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_GreatScientist] Great Scientist point in [ICON_Buildings] University.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]The player enables [ICON_GreatPerson] Noble Prize competitions within the [ICON_Global] World Congress.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Ocean (Guaranteed).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Spawns with [ICON_Science] Sailing and Shipbuilding Technologies.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement for embarked Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Unimproved [ICON_Terrain] Woods and Rainforest gain +1 [ICON_Production] Production; bonus +1 [ICON_Production] Production at the [ICON_Culture] Mercantilism Civic; bonus +1 [ICON_Production] Production at the [ICON_Culture] Conservation Civic.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Food] Food on [ICON_Charges] Fishing Boats.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Fishing Boats trigger a [ICON_Culture] Culture Bomb.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges] Resources cannot be harvested.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot earn [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writers.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Tundra (Tier 1), Snow (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cannot declare Surpise Wars on players or declare War on City-States.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Surprise Wars cannot be declared on the player.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor for every 100 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+100% [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor from completing Emergencies and Competitions.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Desert (Tier 1).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_DISTRICT_CITY_CENTER] City Centers gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food and [ICON_Faith] Faith standard adjacency from all [ICON_Terrain] Desert tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]May purchase [ICON_DISTRICT_COMMERCIAL_HUB] Commercial Hub [ICON_Buildings] Buildings with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges]Mines lose -1 [ICON_Production] Production; gaining +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]-30% [ICON_Production] Production towards most buildable objects; [ICON_Unit] Settlers, Builders, Warriors, Spearmen, Slingers, and Archers do not suffer penalties; [ICON_District] Districts, [ICON_DISTRICT_WONDER] Wonders, and Projects do not suffer penalties.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 3), Geothermal Fissure (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards [ICON_District] Districts and [ICON_Buildings] Buildings built adjacent to a [ICON_DISTRICT_CITY_CENTER] City Center and are across a [ICON_Terrain] River.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Grassland/Plains/Desert Mountains (Tier 2), Tundra/Snow Mountains (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Citizen] Citizens may work [ICON_Terrain] Mountain tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Terrain]Mountain tiles yield +1 [ICON_Production] Production; doubled when entered the [ICON_Science] Industrial Era.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Terrain]Mountain tiles gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food per adjacent [ICON_Charges] Farm and Terrace Farm.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Niter (Tier 5).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_Production] Production towards Siege Units.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Siege Units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength against [ICON_District] Districts.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Occupied] Conquered Cities not founded by the player do not lose [ICON_Citizen] Population, gain +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity, and +4 [ICON_PressureUp] Loyalty per turn.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Grassland (Tier 1), Luxury Resources (Tier 2), Desert/Tundra/Snow (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities do not gain [ICON_Housing] Housing from [ICON_Terrain] Water Sources.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities gain +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity for every [ICON_Charges] Luxury Resource adjacent to the City.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges] Farms gain +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold and [ICON_Housing] Housing.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges] Farms gain standard [ICON_Production] Production adjacency to the [ICON_DISTRICT_CAMPUS] Observatory.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Movement] Movement for [ICON_Unit] Units starting the turn in friendly territory.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Promotion] Promoting a [ICON_Unit] Unit does not end it's turn.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Hills (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]May purchase [ICON_Buildings] Archaeological Museums and [ICON_Unit] Archaeologists with [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges]Improved Resource tiles grant +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each copy of that Resource the City owns.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +0.5 [ICON_Faith] Faith for each Resource in the origin City.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: None.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+2 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength and [ICON_Religion] Religious Strength per Holy City, including the player's Holy City, converted to the player's founded [ICON_Religion] Religion.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Heavy Cavalry class Units spread [ICON_Religion] Religious pressure of the player's majority [ICON_Religion] Religion when killing an enemy [ICON_Unit] Unit.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Non-Capital Cities within 6 tiles of the [ICON_Capital] Capital gain +25% [ICON_Gold] Gold and +50% [ICON_Faith] Faith.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities beyond 7 tiles of the [ICON_Capital] Capital suffer -50% [ICON_Gold] Gold and -75% [ICON_Faith] Faith.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Mine Resources (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+1 [ICON_Culture] Culture on [ICON_Charges] Mines; +1 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism on [ICON_Charges] Mines at the [ICON_Science] Flight Technology.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Charges] Mines [ICON_Culture] Culture Bomb adjacent unclaimed tiles.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_District] Specialty Districts gain minor adjacency from [ICON_Charges] Mines.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_District]Specialty Districts do not gain adjacency from adjacent [ICON_District] Districts and cannot be built next to a [ICON_DISTRICT_CITY_CENTER] City Center.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Rivers (Tier 3).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_TechBoosted] Eurekas provide 75% of a Technology's [ICON_Science] Science cost.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Cities produce 25% less [ICON_Science] Science per turn.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Woods/Rainforest/Marsh (Tier 1).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]All land [ICON_District] Specialty Districts must be placed on [ICON_Terrain] Woods, Rainforest, and Marsh.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Buildings] Buildings in [ICON_District] Districts gain +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture if on [ICON_Terrain] Woods; +1 [ICON_Science] Science if on [ICON_Terrain] Rainforest; +1 [ICON_Production] Production if on [ICON_Terrain] Marsh.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Terrain] Woods can be planted at the [ICON_Culture] Medieval Faires Civic.

[ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Coast (Tier 1).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]International [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Routes gain +50% yields, however they must be sent to Cities on the Coast or that have a [ICON_DISTRICT_HARBOR] Harbor.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_Unit] Traders can embark immediately and gain extended range over [ICON_Terrain] Water tiles, so long as their first tile traversed from the origin City is on Water.

Row.Text: [ICON_Bullet]Spawn Bias: Woods/Rainforest (Tier 2).[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet][ICON_GreatWork_Relic] Relics, [ICON_GreatWork_HeroRelic] Heroic Relics, [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts, and [ICON_GreatWork_Sculpture] Sculptures gain +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, as well as +2 [ICON_Food] Food, [ICON_Production] Production, as well as +4 [ICON_Gold] Gold.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+4 [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work slots in the [ICON_Capital] Palace.[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]+50% [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, and [ICON_GreatMerchant] Great Merchant points.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Production] Production from the adjacent Coast tiles.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Tundra tiles.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Tundra Hills tiles.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Tundra Mountains tiles.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Snow tiles.
+{1_Num} [ICON_Faith] Faith from the adjacent Snow Hills tiles.
